MultiRegVariablesMix 0.1.0
  • Reference

Adam Optimizer

Source: R/AdamOptimizer.R
AdamOptimizer.Rd

Implements the Adam (Adaptive Moment Estimation) optimization algorithm. This optimizer combines the benefits of momentum and RMSProp for efficient and adaptive gradient-based optimization. It is widely used for training deep neural networks and other machine learning models.

Public fields

learning_rate

Learning rate for the optimizer.

beta1

Exponential decay rate for the first moment estimates.

beta2

Exponential decay rate for the second moment estimates.

epsilon

Small constant to avoid division by zero in the update rule.

m

First moment estimate (initialized to zero).

v

Second moment estimate (initialized to zero).

t

Time step (initialized to zero).

Methods

Public methods

  • AdamOptimizer$new()

  • AdamOptimizer$update()

  • AdamOptimizer$clone()

Method new()

Initializes the Adam optimizer with the given parameters.

Usage

AdamOptimizer$new(
  learning_rate = 0.001,
  beta1 = 0.9,
  beta2 = 0.999,
  epsilon = 1e-08,
  weight_dim
)

Arguments

learning_rate

The learning rate for weight updates. Default: 0.001.

beta1

The exponential decay rate for the first moment estimates. Default: 0.9.

beta2

The exponential decay rate for the second moment estimates. Default: 0.999.

epsilon

A small constant for numerical stability. Default: 1e-8.

weight_dim

Dimensions of the weight matrix (e.g., c(rows, cols)).

Method update()

Updates the weights using the Adam optimization algorithm.

Usage

AdamOptimizer$update(W, gradient)

Arguments

W

Current weight matrix.

gradient

Gradient of the loss function with respect to the weights.

Returns

Updated weight matrix after applying the Adam update.

Method clone()

The objects of this class are cloneable with this method.

Usage

AdamOptimizer$clone(deep = FALSE)

Arguments

deep

Whether to make a deep clone.
